intro: Bremeria fuscopilosa, commonly known as the dark-pilose bremeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. The plant is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine. Its ecological importance lies in providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
